name: Hyatt Regency Pier Sixty-Six

reviews.text: We had not been at the Hyatt Pier 66 for some years & thought since it was midway between Miami & Boca & we had relatives to see, we'd revisit. The hotel grounds & lobby are beautifully maintained, but our room left ALOT to be desired! We stayed in the low-rise buildings that either faced the canals or pool area. I cannot comment on the main building's guest rooms, only the room we were in. The furnishings are quite dated, but that would be ok had it not been for the poor condition of the room. The chairs had many stains on them, the airconditioner vent had what appeared to be mold in side. In fact we both woke up coughing every morning & not until the last day did we notice the dirt in the vents.The shower's rubber pads to prevent slipping were worn out or in some spots non existent. We paid $329 per night for that room & we certainly did not get our money's worth. We spent relatively little time at the hotel since the purpose of this trip was visiting relatives so we never bothered to complain. On Saturday the maid did not clean the room until after 4. This hotel caters to cruise lines so I knew that there were many check outs on Saturdays so I didn't complain. If you are going to use the facilities, which we did not, perhaps you can overlook the state of the guest room because the hotel is beautiful, the pool area gorgeous, the proximity to water sports are great, with a marina on the grounds.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with outdated guest rooms

reviews.text: The Hyatt Pier 66 is a real hidden gem. The property is always so relaxing. This time I tried a pool view room. I was surprised at how little noise you actually hear inside your room. There is music playing, families talking, waterfall, etc, yet you hear very little if any of this in your room. The service staff is always great here too. Check in was fairy quick and super courteous. While this is an older hotel, there are no smells or anything that make it bad. The property is kept up very well and clean. The rooms are clean and very nice.
reviews.title: Another Great Visit

reviews.text: My room was nicely decorated and cozy, but yet spacious. The beds are super comfortable. My only complaint with this hotel is the outrageous parking fee. $21 a day to self park and $25 a day to valet. I know this is the norm in South Florida, but it still is aggravating and really a rip off all around the area.
reviews.title: Relaxing hotel

reviews.text: It is located very close to the port if you are coming in for a cruise.
reviews.title: Nice older Hyatt near Port Everglades
Would not stay again - look elsewhere
reviews.text: They have a boat rental place right on site, and one of these times I am going to try them out and sail the inner coastal.

We are fairly new Hyatt Goldpassport members and have enjoyed all our previous stays at Florida Hyatt properties. In 2007 when visiting Ft. Lauderdale, we passed by the Pier 66 during the height of the annual boat show, and made a note to ourselves to stay there on a future visit.
reviews.title: Would Return to the Hyatt Regency Pier 66

likes.liked: — The pool area and the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a central "tower" building as well as many two-story, ranch-style buildings on the property. We were able to choose a first-floor room with a small terrace surrounded by lots of landscaping. The entire property is lush with greenery. Our ground-floor room only had sliding doors on one side making the room dark even during the day - not an issue for us at the beginning of September with the 90 degree heat. This room faced west so that we were able to sleep until 7 a.m. without light coming into the room.
reviews.title: Love Pier 66!

reviews.text: The room and the bathroom were huge, particularly the shower stall. One comment about the equipment in the shower stall: there was just one overhead shower head in addition to the on/off faucet. This is a Hyatt and it looked cheap not to have at least one additional (maybe a hand-held) shower head. I was told the room and bathroom had a make-over in 2007, but it was strictly cosmetic.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

likes.disliked: — Parking fees and left side view from room.

reviews.text: Housekeeping was the worst I have seen in my four Hyatt (property) stay.s..nothing gross, but lacking in attention to detail.
reviews.title: Loved PIer 66
Must be the water
reviews.text: The pool area was great with Hyatt personnel always available to answer questions or help guests. Pool-side food was fresh, tasty and presented well.

We recently stay at Pier 66 for our semi annual company meeting and I must say, the hotel overall was nice (renovations still going on) but not what I'd expect from a Hyatt. The lobby is nice and the staff there was very nice and accomodating. When I had an issue with my internet connection they were very quick to resolve the problem. The hotel has rooms in the tower (didn't stay there so I can't comment) and rooms either with a pool view or a marina view. I had a ground floor room which opened up to the marina which was quite nice. The grounds surrounding the rooms are in need of some TLC because as you walk the grounds you think you are in a motel not a Hyatt hotel. The room itself was nice and comfortable, with a flat screen TV, comfy bed and a nice bathroom. Everything looks relatively newer than I'd expected so my guess is that my room had been recently renovated (maybe within the past 2 years or so).
reviews.title: Nice Stay, but not Hyatt Standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't comment on the pool or the pool bar since I didn't take advantage of either. I did use the tennis courts and they were ok. I heard that the spa was nice and that the gym was outstanding even though I didn't use it. Comments from those that used it said it's the biggest and nicest gym they'd ever seen in a hotel.
reviews.title: Astonishingly DIsgusting!

reviews.text: We had all of our meals catered by the hotel and they were quite good. Not sure if it's the same food that is served if we were just guests eating at their hotel.
reviews.title: Tower getting Better

reviews.text: The ballrooms were all under construction but for our needs we didn't mind. It would be nice if they had wireless service through out the hotel. Maybe they'll upgrade.
reviews.title: Comfortable, attractive

likes.disliked: — not much to do within walking distance

reviews.text: All in all, it's a nice hotel but not sure if I'd pay $286 a night to stay there. Maybe after they've finished upgrading it and bringing it to the Hyatt standards I'm accustomed to.
reviews.title: Great Renovations on a Classic

likes.liked: — Beatutifully remodeled rooms and a great pool.

reviews.text: Just got back for a mother daughter getaway ath the Hyatt. I must tell you that BOBBY THE BELLMAN made out trip even more special. His help and guidance on how to handle our sightseeing along with his suggestions made out stay effortless and memorable. You can tell he truly loves his job..
reviews.title: Service great at the Hyatt

likes.liked: — The service and large rooms, Bobby the Bellman and being able to pick up the water taxi easily

reviews.text: He was such a joy to work with.
reviews.title: Wished I could have stayed longer

reviews.text: All the other staff we encountered were also very accomodating and helpful. From the moment we checked in, we were made to feel welcome and special!
reviews.title: One of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to stay at the Hyatt again, and look forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Stay, though a little "boring"

likes.disliked: — The location is a bit boring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel as a pre-cruise stay for one night. I booked using Hyatt rewards so the room was free. The normal room they give you is the Garden/Marnia room which are small 2 story buildings located around the pool area. Wanting to be higher I asked for a tower room, which they granted. I chose this hotel based on location to cruise port and the Hyatt brand.
reviews.title: Loved this place

likes.liked: — Quality of the resort and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went down to Fort Lauderdale after a very busy Holiday season for a quick decompress. I chose Pier Sixty Six because it's been a fixture since my childhood but never had the opportunity to stay there. Hyatt has done a great job keeping and updating the property and I was surprised to find the rotating top working as I remember. Restaurant food was great with a flare for local Cuban influence, the steakhouse quality was top and service impeccable. The room was comfortable and quiet and who does not like the Hyatt pillow?
reviews.title: Quick getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband wanted to go somewhere warm for Christmas. I found a great package deal on line, Jet Blue and Pier 66. We usually stay in small boutique hotels but the deal was so good we gave the Hyatt a try. Not sure what to expect we remained open minded. Our flight from Boston arrived late so we called the hotel to let them know we would be late. They told us we already had a room and not to hurry. After stopping at Southport Raw Bar (open late, good shrimp and oysters at a great price) we were greeted with a smile at check in. The woman asked us if we were hungry and told us about food options since the restaurants at the hotel were all closed. Already having a warm feeling we thanked her and told her we ate on the way. Our room was big with a beautiful wrap around deck and a spectacular view. OMG we melted into those ever so comfy beds. Richardo at the Lounge was such a pleasure to deal with, funny and entertaining and the best Mojitos . All the associates made us feel at home, with the exception of one. He was not even rude but curt. The grounds at the 66 are beautiful and the pool area is so relaxing. Given the size of the property it is surprising, it must be the layout. I do wish that the parents of children were asked to follow the pool rules. Constant screaming and running is not acceptable. The pool attendant was livid when they stated throwing towels into the pool. The staff at Orchids Pool Bar are a lot of fun and the coffee was not bad. We had a meal at Grill 66 it was quite good. This trip we choose not to rent a car so we spent some time at Pelican Landing waiting for the Water Taxi. The food at Pelican is tasty and the Water Taxi is pretty much on schedule. Grab a drink for the ride, they encourage libations. I think the Water Taxi is a must try, for around twenty bucks a day you can go all day, come back to the 66 and go out again at night. The Water Taxi is such an asset to Ft. Lauderdale. We also used the Sun Trolly, its 50 cents a ride or 2 dollars all day. Not always reliable but sometimes you get lucky and it does add to the fact that Ft. Lauderdale is the best city for getting around without having to cab everywhere. Walking is another good option. There is so much to see. We were a bit disappointed with breakfast. We love to enjoy a leisurely relaxing meal at breakfast, sipping coffee while we plan our day. Mariners was a bit like Grand Central Station, maybe the cruse crowd. Leaving the property for breakfast was not what we wanted. The Lounge would a great place to sip coffee and have the breakfast we had hoped for. Starting our day with a cozy breakfast is most important to us. Both my husband and I had a great Christmas and it had a lot to do with picking 66. Thank you all at Hyatt and have the best New Year. P.S. If you are any kind of a foodie you must checkout Market 17 and remember to take advantage of all the happy hours
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: The staff and facilities at the Pier 66 hotel were very accommodating and appropriate for the cost and quality level of this property. The room (tower suite) was very large and sitting area was most appreciated. Daily maid service was fine, with nice touches like a travel-sized toothpaste tube provided (every day but one). This room faced the A1A highway and cruise ship port, and had considerable noise with the balcony door ajar, and a noticeable smell of yacht fuel when ships arrived or departed, depending on the wind. Visiting a room facing north/ northeast, with a partial view over the ocean was significantly quieter and more pleasant, but it was too short a stay to warrant a room change. The dinner at the lobby bar (main restaurant) was fairly poor and greasy and the service was slow. Many restaurants are less than a mile away west on the A1A. the pool was nice, with a 25 yard section for lap swimming though the water a bit warm for a serious workout. For real swimmers, visit the nearby Swimming Hall of Fame Olympic-sized pools. Bought room via TravelZoo so particularly good value, but I could see staying here again even on a regular rate. Lots of cruise ship passengers seem to stay here before their cruise due to its proximity to the cruise port. Finally, the buffet breakfast offers an extensive fare and would seem to be pretty good value.
reviews.title: Good hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I have enjoyed many stays at the Hyatt over the years; always being extremely happy with the experience. Many of the employees have contributed to our enjoyment including Ben Johnson who has been a great help to us, as well as Nicole with in-house reservations and Camille at the front desk. On our two most recent stays, however, we did have issues that need to be addressed.
reviews.title: I'm sorry to have to write this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We most recently stayed on November 6 and November 17. On the morning of check out for our November 6 stay, the housekeeper let herself into our room while we were still occupying it. She claims she knocked, which we did not hear. I found this very intrusive and upsetting that she would just let herself in, especially being that it wasn’t even close to check out time. I let the situation go assuming it was some type of fluke or miscommunication between departments. Being that we are always so happy and everyone is typically so accommodating I didn’t want to complain.
reviews.title: Poor customer service. Cheaper rooms not even in tower!

reviews.text: I can only say excellent things for the Hyatt Regency Pier 66. I don't understand so many of the negative things being said, but I had an excellent stay there while in town for a travel conference from November 29 - December 2. The hotel has not completed all of the renovations and the lobby has not been completed, but when done I know it will be beautiful. It had been many years since I have stayed at Pier 66, but I had forgotten how large the tower rooms were. My room (1263) had been completely renovated, with the new Hyatt Grand bed, LG flat panel LCD TV, new furnishings and new marble bathroom. The balcony was huge looking over downtown Ft Lauderdale, overlooking the pool, and to one side the Port Everglades. I used Spa 66 which had a great steamroom and sauna. I can't wait to return to Pier 66 and the city and beaches of Ft Lauderdale once again.
reviews.title: Beautiful as always!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here one night prior to taking a Carnival Cruise. We did some research on the Hyatt website and also Trip advisor. Our past experiences with Hyatt had been tremendous so we we're looking forward to starting our vacation with the "Hyatt" treatment.
reviews.title: Highly disappointed

likes.disliked: — Showing it's age -- needs imploded and built new.

reviews.title: Overpriced
reviews.text: The location to the cruise port is excellent -- within 5 minutes. The people working at the Hyatt were very pleasant. However the hotel public areas are undergoing construction and therefore they have a makeshift breakfast area with a very small check-in lobby area. The restaurant on top of the Hyatt has not been in operation for over 2 years.

Our first room had a leak in the ceiling and had plaster/drywall on the floor. The bellman arranged for another room for us. The 2nd room had mold in the corners of the ceiling but we decided to stay. The hotel is showing it's age.
reviews.title: Needs a lot of work

likes.disliked: — The bug infestation in our rooms and the fact that they ignored all of our complaints

reviews.text: The fire alarm system went off around 11pm and stayed on for a good 30 minutes. It was a false alarm but there were fire trucks and they conducted an inspection. At 2am there was another false alarm and then another false alarm at 11am when we were leaving the hotel. It was not a very restful night.
reviews.title: Should be nice when finished

likes.disliked: — In the middle of a remodel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Imagine no flushing toilet, no shower and no water in your room until 8 PM at night. That's the predicament we found ourselves in at the Hyatt. We all know that things can happen that are out of the control of the best in lodging. But it's how it is handled that counts. We plunked down our credit card and proceeded to our room along the intercoastal waterway. It was a long hike from the hotel lobby. Surprise - no water ! The registration desk never said a word, the bell hop never mentioned it - we had to call to find out. We were told it would be on by early afternoon. Okay, we'll go to lunch. We get back at 4 PM. No water, no message on the phone. We call again. We were told to use the bathrooms at the yacht club. I went to the lobby for a glass of water and I listened to see if the front desk was informing new comers of the absence of running water. Not a word. In fact I hear one of the desk clerks flippantly telling another how people expected him to do something about it. Now the yacht club is a bit of a hike - no offer to take us in one of the golf carts they have on the property. I noticed a guy using the waterfall in the pool to wash his hair. Other than offering to bring us water, there was nothing provided for the major inconvenience of the hotel guests. I thought a complimentary breakfast or even a discount was in order. Regarding the room. It was clean and ordinary. It was advertised as a marina view. I guess you can call a yacht parked outside your room as such. To me it was just a big obstruction of the view ! My recommendations - stay at the Hilton if you want to be close to the water taxi.
reviews.title: Poor Communication of Problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only reason i gave this even a "1" rating is for the pool area .... it was most impressive and the pool attendants were very accommodating in moving umbrellas, tables, lounges, etc.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY !
Worked out on the plus side for us in the end
reviews.text: the hotel is in desperate need of a redo .... it was sad and lonely, the carpets were stained and soiled, the room was spacious, but the drapes and carpets AND furniture needed to be replaced .... the bed was comfy tho .... the housekeeping staff was extremely noisy (laughing and chit chatting with other staff) in the hallway when we were trying to sleep past 9:00 a.m.
i was sooooo disappointed and this brought the end of our lovely cruise to a screeching halt - just sayin'
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.text: One night stay per-cruise early Dec. booked through Hotwire for a good value rate but not allowed to go for a tower room without paying more. Never the less happy with a lanai room close to reception. Even furthest lanai suites not impossibly far as suggested by some. Great pool area and grounds. Room large with very nice bathroom and huge shower. All good so far. Then came a blow from left field......the water supply went down. From just before noon, we were told that the poolside bathrooms could not be used. We did not realize that the entire resort was affected because of a problem with the city mains. No water anywhere to be had. Can't wash your hands. No showers. No toilets. Each hour, we were told that "we have been told by the city that it will be restored within another or so". This dragged on until 6.00pm. We then went to have dinner at the Pier 66 Restaurant at the far end of the grounds, having first ascertained that they had running water. (Can you imagine the hygiene concerns eating at an establishment with no running water?)
reviews.title: Did not expect from Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i love Ft Lauderdale and have never stayed at this property before, so i was excited! one look at the pool online and i was sold! i knew the place was going to be under construction, so i was prepared. i am sorry but there was a horrible smell every time you walked thru the door, so bad that i didnt eat at any of the restarants they had to offer LOL. talk about being picky.
reviews.title: Best pool in town!

reviews.text: HOWEVER, i had the BEST stay and i loved the hotel itself. it was very elegant and i had a room in the tower bldg, which was the nicest. i loved my view, i had a view of the marina AND the ocean, you cant get better than that. we got to see cruise ships comming and going. i had a small problem the night i arrived, the shower stopped when i was in the shower and the light in the bathroom where the toilet was went out....but we called the front desk and when we returned back, it was all resolved with a card apologizing.
reviews.title: Pier Sixty-Six needs a little TLC

reviews.text: there are HUGE flat screens in every room, ice makers all over the place, it was a nice nice hotel. i usually stay at the ritz, and was just at the Ritz Carlton, and i would take this property over that one any day. the beds were SO comfy and the bathroom was luxurious! cant say enough. the best part was the pool tho, there are 2 pools and a HUGE hot tub that was the size of a pool, 30 people could easily fit in it and you could swim the length of it. thats how big it was! it wasnt hot at night tho, just warm, but thats better than cold! one pool was heated, the other one wasnt. it was very refreshing! they offer floats for $7 a day, and you can float around the pool. each pool had a waterfall. LOVED it. there were tons of little geckos running around, it was very serene. they offer cabanas if youd like. there is no towel service, you are on your own, no biggie!
reviews.title: very poor - lots of issues

likes.disliked: — Everything but the views - definitely a below average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: only complaint: in the stairs of the VERY clean pool, there was many bugs, candy wrappers etc...but after you got thru that mess, you were in a VERY clean pool...it was weird...but when i saw the dead ROACH, i couldnt get in that pool again. (this was the heated pool) so i stayed in the cold pool the rest of my stay LOL.
reviews.title: We would do it again....We Loved the Hyatt Pier 66

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the parking is valet or park yourself and they DO charge a resort fee, which is about 13-15$ a day, that you wont find out about untill you check out. we complained and this was taken off our bill.
reviews.title: Loved the Tower Balcony View

likes.liked: — The Balcony View, The Comfy Bed
likes.disliked: — More Restraunts open, they have 4, why have only 1 open on a Sunday night?

reviews.text: The hotel itself is a bit old, (seventies refurbished?).
reviews.title: Perfect pre-cruise hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Lanai rooms, which are behind the main building, with a balcony overlooking the marina.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience
3 years for renovations, and still not done? Not recommended.
reviews.text: Rooms are very confortable, superior beds and linen, Marble bathrooms, nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was the best of all, payed $119 per night, which is a good price for Hyatt chain, I wanted to have dinner at the hotel but the restaurant on the hotel roof was closed due to a private party. no breakfast included.
reviews.title: not what i expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the perfect pre-cruise hotel, and a fantastic pool!
reviews.title: 5 star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You know some times it is Karma and some times, it just works out right.
reviews.title: Great Hotel wish you were here!

likes.liked: — Location, food and Caring accomidating Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had taken a long shot and booked this hotel, even after reading some of the less than favorable reviews on this site. I am from California but also have a place to stay in Naples, but since we were going on a cruise, I thought that staying near the port would be smart. I am sure glad that I did.
reviews.title: Awful experience, incompetent front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was recently remodeled, and features a very upscale modern airy lobby, with an enticing view of the expansive pool. We had left Naples early to make sure to get to the hotel in plenty of time, and be able to look where we needed to go the next day. We arrived at the hotel about 1pm, and they did not have the room ready yet. We had not unloaded the car yet, and we were going to drive around some. The hotel said that they would call us, and that all we needed to do is get the keys from the front desk when we returned.
reviews.title: Nice getaway hotel if you can get a good rate

likes.liked: — Grounds, quiet location, view of the cruise port
likes.disliked: — Wide range of quality in rooms ...if you are booked in Lanai section...recommend Tower upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out to the car and we had not gone 5 blocks and the phone rings. “Room is ready sir” A quick U-e and we were back at the valet. The bellmen were efficient and helpful. Five minutes and a few dollars tip later we were on the 15th floor, looking at 6 cruise ships and a wedding party about to begin.
reviews.title: Nice time at the Hyatt Pier 66

likes.liked: — view of the pier, the lcd tv
likes.disliked: — room was humid, a/c unit was very loud

reviews.title: No heat in the Tower
reviews.text: I was apprehensive when I heard that the wedding party was using the hotel all weekend, but it was surprisingly quiet. I am a light sleeper, but I slept like a baby.

reviews.title: We found this hotel very pleasant.
reviews.text: We had a room right on the canal and have no complaints about it. The pools are great and the restaurants very good. We especially enjoyed the Pelican Landing. Room service dinner was delivered quickly with the food delicious and piping hot. Only complaint is that the fridge in the room is not really a fridge. When we complained we were told It is supposed to keep food cold but not get it cold. What? The ice cold soda and water we put in the night before was room temp. in the morning. But all in all we were very pleased. I am glad we were not scared away by some of ther rerviews here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night prior to a Silversea cruise. I've been a Hyatt Gold Passport member for over 30 years. This is a pale imitation of what a Hyatt is supposed to be.
reviews.title: Not at ALL up to Hyatt Standards-beware!!!

likes.liked: — location and the restaurant on the second floor of the pier
likes.disliked: — service, front desk, bell service, attitude

reviews.text: I had stayed at the property when I was a child and had stayed there are few years back on a quick trip to Fort Lauderdale. No problems then.
reviews.title: Loved Pier 66

reviews.text: The hotel is OLD. I know it's been there for over 50 years. They've tried to upgrade it but do not mistake this for a recently-built, new, modern Hyatt. The tropical climate and humidity and marginal room maintenance/painting/renovation/repairs make it clear it's seen a lot of use.
reviews.title: Only if you must

reviews.text: Upon arrival by taxi from FLL, the bell staff was the worst of ANY major hotel chain in years. The driveway staff loaded the bags and moved them inside. Tthey sat there forever because the only bellman on duty, the sole bellman, who was probably older than I am, never reappeared to get them to our room. This is a big property and to have one bellman on duty is simply unbelievable.
reviews.title: Still have work to do

reviews.text: We just got back from a short vacation in Fort Lauderdale where we stayed at the Hyatt Regency Pier 66. This hotel was exceptional. The staff and the service was 1st rate. The room was pleasant and the beds were very comfortable. The pool and the extras (grapes, Evian Water Spray, cool towels) was just what we were looking for our short get away. The entertainment at the Pelican Landing was great and we had so much fun. We would go to the beach for a little while, but we always came back to the Hotel to enjoy all that it had to offer. BH, Newtown, PA [---]
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.text: Let me get directly to the point. The customer service at this hotel - - OUTSTANDING! The shuttle to the beach, the directions and advice from the gentlemen that greeted me outside the hotel, the lady that checked me in, the staff that maintained my room – every person made me feel at home and provided top-notch customer service. Then, my co-worker arrived later that evening and her room was not available because of “mechanical problems.” Unfortunately, they had to put her at another location for one evening but the customer service sprang into action. Luis (I think his last name was Navaro) demonstrated excellent customer service in realizing our frustration and making sure that the remainder of her (and my) stay was outstanding.
reviews.title: A+ for Customer Service

reviews.text: I enjoyed everything about this property during my week-long visit to the Fort Lauderdale area. The staff of the Hyatt Pier 66, and Luis in particular, is responsible for producing a loyal Hyatt customer for years to come.
reviews.title: Great customer service!!!
great trip as usual at hyatt
reviews.text: I just returned from a conference in Ft. Lauderdale, FL. The Hyatt Pier 66 made a great finish to a bad start. After traveling for 16 hours, I arrived at the Hyatt only to find that maintenance problems made my room unavailable. Tired, exhausted, and completely upset at 12:30 am, the hotel transferred me to another Hyatt resort (Bahia Mar). The Bahia Mar was below average and when I returned to the Hyatt Pier 66, I was more than frustrated. The manager at the Hyatt, Luis Navarro, went above and beyond his call of duty to make this bad experience into a Great One!! First, Luis "comped" my room at the Bahia Mar, upgraded me to a junior suite, and provided complimentary breakfast's for the rest of my stay. In addition, my travel companion and I had extended our vacation and Luis provided us a reasonable rate at the Hyatt with a junior suite. The room was large, luxurious, and had huge balconies. I give this hotel an Excellent rating along with Luis Navarro, the manager on staff during my stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our 4th weekly stay at the hyatt with family.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a two night stay at this lovely hotel. We booked via Priceline for less than $100 per night. I called ahead of time and requested a king, non-smoking room. The front desk person said, "no problem," I'll put you in the tower. When we arrived, the room we were originally scheduled for wasn't ready, so the front desk person asked, "Would you mind a different room?" We said no problem, but still preferred a King non-smoking room. She said, "how about if I put you on the 15th floor in the tower?" (Great room, one level below the top floor, with a huge wrap-around balcony so you could see the inter-coastal waterway, downtown sky-line, and ocean in the distance)! We LOVED our room! Talk about a great room with a view! The king bed was extra comfy with both down pillows and synthetic pillows, super soft sheets, and a down comforter. The room also had a flat screen LCD HD TV, a refrigerator, room safe, closet and extra large bathroom. We very rarely heard anyone else on the floor, although we did hear someone next door one morning. Housekeeping did an excellent job and the hotel was fabulous. They have beautiful grounds, including a wonderful pool and hot tub. The hotel is about a mile from the beach and they have a complimentary shuttle that will take you there during the day, running on the hour. We walked one day and it took about 20 minutes. There is a Broward County bus stop right outside the hotel entrance. An all day bus pass costs only $3 per person and we used that for almost all of our transportation. It runs both directions on 17th street, Hwy A1A, every thirty minutes. There is a Hess convenience store right across the street with a Blimpy's sandwich shop. Great sub sandwich/meals for about $5. I can't say enough good things about our stay at this Hyatt. I had heard there was a "resort fee" but they did not charge us one. Parking is around $20 a day, so we opted out of the rental car and just used public transportation. I thank the Hyatt folks for helping us have a wonderful mini-vacation!
reviews.title: Great stay at Pier Sixty-Six

likes.liked: — Beautiful views from the balcony in our tower room

reviews.text: Was booked by a friend at the hotel. DIdn't know what to expect, but was wonderfully surprised. The service was flawless, the hotel lobby was gorgeously tropical, and the room was exceptionally clean, big, and had an amazing marina view. I would highly recommend this hotel to singles, couples, or families in leisure or business trips as it suits everyone.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend at the Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the hyatt in march for 3 nights before going on a cruise,we had seen the reviews on this website and were very concerned because they weren't great but we need not have worried because we couldn't have picked a better place.
reviews.title: high standards at the hyatt

reviews.text: The resort was beautiful and very clean the rooms were spacious and very clean with a gorgeous view of the intercoastal waterway ,they had every amenity you could wish for.In short we loved the hyatt and will definately be returning in the future. We would like to thank the staff for making our honeymoon one we will never forget. darren and susan, ireland
reviews.title: I know it's late but.....
An excellent pre-cruise stay
reviews.text: This was really a non eventful stay and in my book that is a good thing! The room was exceptionally clean and the staff were very good. We only stayed one night precruise and got a good rate. I've wanted to stay at this hotel for many years and finally had the chance. For just one night, probably for most people more that you would want to spend if you are on a budget. I could honestly say I would stay again, hopefully for more than one night. The beds were really firm and comfortable which I like. We did not get the chance to use the pool or any other amenities on site, we did take the water taxi from the hotel to Las Olas for dinner. Loved being able to walk among the yachts to the taxi and check them all out. The morning we left for our cruise I went to the top in the elevator and checked out the harbor and saw our ship just to make sure she made it back and was ready for us! There was a private function getting ready to start but they let me in to take a look at the ships, it was an awesome view! The view from our room was great and once it was dark all the lights were beautiful.

We absolutely loved this hotel!! We stayed in a tower room and it was beautiful. After reading so many reviews I was really concerned about my choice but I am glad that I stuck with it. The pool, lobby, room bedding, LCD tv, balcony and bathroom was all fabulous. I looked for wear in the room and could not find any.
reviews.title: We Loved It....
High priced motel
reviews.text: We had a beautiful view of the Fort Lauderdale skyline and the ocean. Because we were in a room with 2 double beds we weren't able to get a room with the view or the pier but was able to see the cruise ships come in at 6 in the morning, which was very cool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the Pelican Bar once and had room service for breakfast. Both were tasty and priced comperable to what we have paid in other hotels. With that said, I am still offended by the $9 we paid for a Pina Colada in the bar.
reviews.title: Hyatt Pier 66 - nothing special

likes.liked: — The close proximity to the cruise ship terminal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have a car, the beach is 5 to 10 minutes away and is pretty cool. There are a lot of reasonably priced restaurants and shops there which is where we ate most of our meals.
reviews.title: Amazing Stay

reviews.text: Have a great stay....
reviews.title: Decent, will be great when renovations completed & cleaning staff is quieter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I checked in August 3rd for a one night stay before our cruise. Our room was not ready yet, which was fine since we arrived at noon. We had lunch at the pool side restaurant and it was wonderfully delicious in a beautiful setting. Upon check in I inquired about spa treatments and SPA 66 was able to see me within in an hour for a body wrap and massage. If you do choose a massage at Spa 66 I highly recommended requesting BILL. I was completely exhausted from traveling all morning and waking at 4:30 AM. I did not expect to have any energy for much, but Bill was able to correct that. I was completely amazed. He used a serious of different massage techniques including stretching of my muscles and working out stress areas. At one point he told me he was going to simulate the ocean, at first I thought this might be weird. I was completely wrong, it was so relaxing I actually felt like I was laying on the ocean floor and waves were passing over my back. I left my massage completely rejuvenated and energized so much that I was out exploring Fort Lauderdale on foot till 11pm.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, Great Start to a vacation!

likes.disliked: — Location! Location! Location! Not walking distance to beach :(

reviews.title: Summer 08
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful with a large wrap around balcony that provided views of port everglades and the inter-coastal water ways. We woke to a view of our cruise ship, this was exciting. The pools are wonderful and very large with depths up to 6ft. One pool is cooler than the other for a wonderful way to cool off mid-day. The Hot tub is huge, it is as big as the cooler dipping pool. This is all set among palm trees creating a beautiful tropical setting. The other bonus, the pools are open 24hrs. The hotel is very clean and sheik with a music in the lobby changing through out the day to fit the time/mood of the moment.

Getting around is easy by water taxi that is $13.00 a person for an all day pass. They do provide a guided tour and request tips. The beach is not within walking distance. It is about a ten dollar cab ride away. The beach is alive all day and at night. It is not uncommon to find people swimming in the ocean even at night. Beach Place is a wonderful place to shop and eat. You can convince some shops to sell at a lower price. I had excellent luck with a shop by the name of Stylin.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service

reviews.text: Hope this helps paint a real picture.
reviews.title: A Four Star That Is Really a Five Star!

likes.liked: — the hotel's well trained professional staff

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights with my family. 4 of us all together in a two bed room, two adults, two kids.... Two very comfortable queen sized beds. I am a Diamond member of the Hyatt hotels, so I was given a very nice room on a high floor with partial view of the ocean and the causeway, very nice. The room was clean and nicely decorated, all furniture and room decorations seemed new or very well kept. As a diamond member I was provided with free breakfast for all members of my family plus a wine bottle of my choice upon arrival, plus some cookies for the girls.
reviews.title: All Around Great Property

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds and bedding, the view and spacious balcony

reviews.text: We went on a cruise from Fort Lauderdale. The night before, we stayed at the Hyatt. We were impressed with the helpful and friendly service from the time we stepped out of the taxi. Camelia checked us in at the front desk and was so friendly and answered all our questions. She noticed we were staying another 2 nights after our cruise and made sure to block out 2 rooms for us, in a great location on the property. The rooms were right by the pools, and had a great patio area to relax and read in the evening and early morning. We appreciated the free shuttle to and from the beach every hour. We walked to Shula Burger from the hotel twice while there. The kids loved it! Bubba Gumps, at the beach, was a good family place for dinner. The pool was large and well equipped with chairs in sun and shade. The breakfast buffet was a bit spendy for 5 people, but was very delicious and the service was good. The pool bar also offers a breakfast selection that is quick and fairly inexpensive. When we make it back to Fort Lauderdale, with or without the kids, this is where we will stay!
reviews.title: Great Place for our family!

reviews.text: Booked this hotel for one night as a pre-cruise stay. It has a great pool and many dining options but they could be as easily accessed from other locations as they are a bit of a walk from the hotel itself. We had a room with a waterway view so we were facing the boats and heard people come and go. The room itself was standard for a 3-star hotel but felt like a motel with low ceilings and lack of natural light unless you opened curtains and felt like you were in a fish bowl for boaters passing by. A ride to the port was also rather pricey as the hotel staff directed us to mini-van shuttles that charged $7.00 per person. For a family of 3 it was more expensive than our ride from the airport. Based on what I know now I would book the Embassy Suites or one of the other hotels that are located on the other part of the bridge for a pre-cruise stay. They are closer to the shops and dining venues, and even to the port.
reviews.title: Good enough for a pre/post cruise stay.

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the Lanai rooms overlooking the waterway. View was very nice and recommended over the pool views. There are also a few rooms overlooking the parking lot (to be avoided). The room itself was rather basic for what one would expect from a 4-star Hyatt property and furniture/decoration was limited. The bathrooms are somewhat outdated. Housekeeping was very noisy shouting across the corridors with each other. Towels were often missing and rooms, particularly the bathrooms were not properly cleaned. Staff at the reception are neither unfriendly nor friendly, rather 'cold'. The grounds/pool area are very nice and the beach shuttle provides easy access (5mins) to the nearby ft Lauderdale beach.
reviews.title: nice grounds, shame about the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nites in the lanai building; we had no car but you are close to the water taxis and there are restaurants within the hotel and we had breakfast included in the basic rate.
reviews.title: Great location, good pre-cruise location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to the port and the airport. They have a shuttle service to the port for $11 per person.
reviews.title: Post Cruise Hotel Stay - Enjoyed!

aka: Hyatt Regency Pier Sixty-Six Hotel Fort Lauderdale
description: Hyatt Regency Pier Sixty-Six, a South Florida landmark resort in the heart of Fort Lauderdale, is a 22-acre tropical retreat featuring a world-class marina; Spa 66, the signature health and beauty spa; and a full-service Aquatic Center. A refreshed classic, the resort boasts a new contemporary lounge and function space, along with 384 spacious guestrooms and suites, a spectacular three-pool oasis, and five dining outlets offering everything from incredible waterfront views to innovative, fine dining.
